comment_body: @judyjoseph and @abdosi, HI Judy and Abhishek, Per discussion and request, the PR is for the optimization.
@mlok-nokia please create PR for 202205 branch. We can not cherry-pick as the repo has changed.
There is no 20205 branch in this repo yet. Advance submodule in buildimage 202205 branch is sufficient.

> There is no 20205 branch in this repo yet. Advance submodule in buildimage 202205 branch is sufficient.

Hi Ying,  There is another PR which is in the pending to merge this change to 202205.  Please help to review and merge it.  Thanks.
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/13064
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25922744/204503556-88c0b152-7f84-4798-96a3-ddc41e23df74.png)
Hi @mkeda, I have fixed/replied all comments. Would you please review the new changes?
@mkeda  please help to review and approve the PR if you are ok. Thanks.
Why is the executable bit being unset for `scripts/hostcfgd`?

> Why is the executable bit being unset for `scripts/hostcfgd`?

Will fix.
Hi @saiarcot895, I have fixed the file permission, could you please check?
@abdosi Thank you for the quick fix. The change of EXTERNAL_CLIENT was also merged into 202012 and 202205 branch, could you please submit your change into these 2 branches too? Thanks a lot!
Hi @abdosi  , need this fix on the 202205 branch as well. Thanks!
@judyjoseph can you update this also: config db that write `has-per-asic-scope` for all namespace.

@abdosi have added the support for **has-per-asic-scope** also -- Can you check again 

Validated the following 

1. Checked that the has-per-asic-scope is synced up correctly across the DBs in namespaces. 
    Note: In chassis find that the time it takes for hostcfgd to go in through loops for all processes is big high -- so this variable is updated with the right state tue/false takes some time. We need to check if we can reduce the looping time in SUP as there are more asics per feature.
2. User change the feature state dynamically using cli -- it updates the local DB and the DBs in namespaces.
3. checked these changes are not affecting the single asic device
cc @arlakshm @judyjoseph
cc @anamehra @SuvarnaMeenakshi

yes this should get merge soon.

@sujinmkang can you test this on Dell Z9332F
echo 1  |  sudo tee -a /proc/sys/kernel/sysrq
echo c  |  sudo tee -a /proc/sysrq-trigger

This should cause the system to reboot due to crash

See if you see the correct reboot cause
@sujinmkang please make sure this is ported to 202205

Please help to review it again. Thanks!
@ZhaohuiS , we need to get this for 202205. Can you please have the submodule update for 202205?

@prsunny Sure, will also add print warning log if dst_port is not defined.

> @ZhaohuiS , we need to get this for 202205. Can you please have the submodule update for 202205?

@prsunny I submitted in https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/11962 for 202205 branch. Please review, thanks.
Ping @prsunny @bingwang-ms
Ping @prsunny @bingwang-ms

The expectation is that, this /32 DROP rule shall be installed at the end. If any control or other protocol (ssh/snmp etc) is required to be allowed, the user must explicitly add allow rules above the DROP rule

> The expectation is that, this /32 DROP rule shall be installed at the end. If any control or other protocol (ssh/snmp etc) is required to be allowed, the user must explicitly add allow rules above the DROP rule

@prsunny On the meeting in February we agreed that this DROP should be removed (see https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/9826#issuecomment-1041923180)  , has new information come forth or has anything else changed?

> > The expectation is that, this /32 DROP rule shall be installed at the end. If any control or other protocol (ssh/snmp etc) is required to be allowed, the user must explicitly add allow rules above the DROP rule
> 
> @prsunny On the meeting in February we agreed that this DROP should be removed (see [sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#9826 (comment)](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/9826#issuecomment-1041923180)) , has new information come forth or has anything else changed?

I see, thanks for pointing out.  For default ssh via mgmt, this change is required. lgtm, @yxieca to review as well.

@SuvarnaMeenakshi Thanks for flagging that. After taking a quick look at the tests and `verify_cacl` it seems to me that those tests are  redundant to the unit tests introduced with this PR.

As long as we have tests that depend on the exact iptables rule output, which those tests you linked do, any changes to the rule logic in this repo will be really hard to do, as is evident with the current case @SuvarnaMeenakshi is bringing up.

My take: I recommend that the linked unit tests are deleted (or significantly reduced), as we are now testing that behavior in this repo's own tests. That way we test the specifics in this repo, and we test the manifested outcome (e.g try to run SSH or just open a port) instead of exactly how is implemented.

Thoughts?

> @SuvarnaMeenakshi Thanks for flagging that. After taking a quick look at the tests and `verify_cacl` it seems to me that those tests are redundant to the unit tests introduced with this PR.
> 
> As long as we have tests that depend on the exact iptables rule output, which those tests you linked do, any changes to the rule logic in this repo will be really hard to do, as is evident with the current case @SuvarnaMeenakshi is bringing up.
> 
> My take: I recommend that the linked unit tests are deleted (or significantly reduced), as we are now testing that behavior in this repo's own tests. That way we test the specifics in this repo, and we test the manifested outcome (e.g try to run SSH or just open a port) instead of exactly how is implemented.
> 
> Thoughts?

We should keep the unit-tests and sonic-mgmt tests as sonic-mgmt tests.
You suggestion to test the outcome does seem right, but my understanding is that we compare the rules as it easier when compared to testing possible outcome for all the cacls. 
In the interest of time to make sure that we are able to update sonic-host-services submodule, I have created an issue to track this: https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12464. Will try to have a easy fix in sonic-mgmt repo to unblock and can be fine tuned later.
